title: Ticket #5935: Condor_submit should create output directory if it doesn't exist
description: I'm in the process of verifying whether this would deal with Michael's issue, but TJ, Greg and I all like the idea of condor_submit automatically creating output directories better than making $(cluster) work as an argument to include commands in submit files.
remarks:
2016-Sep-30 14:59:56 by iain.steers:
We and our users would certainly appreciate any directory structure mentioned in output, error and log being created if it doesn't already exist.

2016-Oct-07 10:23:36 by wenger:
Hmm -- here's an alternative suggestion from Michael:

That brings another possibility to mind - how about a submit directive to have the starter create a directory tree in scratch space for the owner? This would be distinct from the transfer_input_files - the directory to be created wouldn't exist on the submit host when the job is submitted. For example: 

  My_output_dir = batch_$(Cluster)/run_$(Process)
  Create_scratch_subdir = $(output_dir)
  Remote_initialdir = $(output_dir)
  Transfer_output_files = batch_$(Cluster)

The create_scratch_subdir would be parsed in the same manner as transfer_input_files, as a comma-separated list. Specifying an absolute path would throw an error.
creator: wenger
